intro: Delphinium ramosissimum, commonly known as the Sierra delphinium, is a herbaceous perennial native to the western United States. It features tall, sparsely branched stems that can reach heights of up to 2 meters. The plant produces showy, blue to purple spires of flowers in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rugged appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a striking addition to alpine gardens.
